Foreseeability.origin: [reasonable of probable consequences " Gerwin v. Southeastern Cal. Ass'n of Seventh Day Adventists , 14 Cal. App. 3d 209 (1971)"]

1.definition: the quality or state of being foreseeable [reasonable of probable consequences ", 14 Cal. App. 3d 209 (1971)"]

2.definition: the doctrine esp. of tort and contract law that liability is limited to losses that are foreseeable see alsoin the Important Cases section
